alert.note: Alert for Chatham; Harnett; Johnston; Lee; Moore; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 30 at 11:04PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Chatham, Harnett, Johnston, Lee, Moore and Wake. * WHEN...Until 500 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1101 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated the heaviest rainfall has moved out of the area. However, light to occasionally moderate rainfall is expected. - A few creeks remain out of their banks, but they are expected to recede in the next few hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Raleigh, Durham, Cary, Sanford, Southern Pines, Smithfield, Pittsboro, Lillington, Carthage, Siler City, Wake Forest, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, Clayton, Pinehurst, Dunn, Zebulon, Angier, Benson and Goldston. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Chatham; Harnett; Johnston; Lee; Moore; Wake
